description.narrative: EU-kommissionen har beslutat att avsätta totalt 40 miljoner euro från EU:s Sk "Emergency Trust Fund" för att stödja genomförandet av IGAD:s freds- och säkerhetsstrategi under perioden 2018-2022, varav 5 miljoner Euro kommer gå till lönekostnader och 35 miljoner euro tilldelas 'IGAD Promoting Peace and Stability in the Horn of Africa Region', IPPSHAR-programmet. Programmets riktning är helt i linje med den svenska strategin och dess fokus på förstärkt kapacitet bland regionala aktörer för fred och försoning, ökat kvinnligt deltagande i fredsprocesser och bekämpning av våldsbejakande extremism. Sverige kommer att tilldela 10,5 miljoner kronor för genomförandet av programmet, pengarna kommer att ställas till förfogande för användandet av Österrikes Biståndsorgan, ADA, som är utsedd som partner ansvarig för genomförande av det delegerade EU-avtalet och Sidas bidrag. ADA bidrar med ytterligare 1 million Euro till programmet och Nederländerna bidrar med ca 600.000 euro. Insatsens totala summa är därför 42,6 miljoner euro.

The EU Commission has decided to allocate a total of EURO 40 million from the EU Trust Fund to support the implementation of IGAD's Peace and Security Strategy during the period 2018-2022, of which 5 million euro will go to salary costs and 35 million will go to the 'IGAD Promoting Peace and Stability in the Horn of Africa Region, IPPSHAR, programme.The direction of the programme is fully in line with the Swedish strategy, and its focus on strengthened capacities among regional actors for peace and reconciliation, increased women's participation in processes for peace, and combating of violent extremism. Sweden will allocate 10,5 MSEK for the implementation of the programme, the funds will be made available for the use of the Austrian Development Agency (ADA) who has been appointed as the managing agent of the delegated EU-agreement as well as Sida's contribution. ADA is contributing an additional 1 million euro to the IPPSHAR programme and the Netherlands is contributing with 676,579 euro. The total contribution amount is therefore 42.6 million euro.

To contribute to achieving sustainable peace, security and stability for the attainment of economic integration and development in the IGAD region (Djibouti, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Kenya, Somalia, South Sudan, Sudan and Uganda).

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Implementation of the Action remains low, however, greater progress compared to the first year. As per the report, the picture for year two is much more positive, with implementation of activities increasing over the first two quarters, reaching a peak in the third quarter and dropping again in the fourth quarter. Among others, the reason for low implementation rate towards the end of the implementation year includes, the COVID-19 crisis where required travel for some of the planned activities within the member states were banned. Throughout the second year of IPPSHAR implementation, IGAD activities such as workshops, meetings, trainings and conferences have benefitted a total of 2,138 people out of the targeted 3,005, achieving 71% of its target. On average, these activities registered 34% of female participation. Some of the achievements reported is highlighted below: SO1 attained result 1.1: Better and faster data gathering, analysis, anticipation, and dissemination. This result has further been strengthened by the identification of National Research Institutes (NRI) and orientation on Integrated CEWARN data collection and analysis systems in addition to building the capacity of NRIs and the CEWARN unit to enhance their analytical capacity. In addition, CEWARN has routinely collected, analysed, and disseminated spatial data and analytics reflecting regional civil dissent incidents and epicentres. This is important in terms of identifying locations where they appear to be persistent, emerging or escalating for purposes of early warning and understanding of underlying factors for appropriate and timely mitigation. SO2 attained result 2.2: Strengthened institutional and human capacity of IGAD and national governments to effectively address TSTs. Numerous capacity development trainings were held which focused on countering terrorism and violent extremism and community engagement in preventing and countering serious and organized crime. Regional organisations, such as the Regional Centre on Small Arms in the Great Lakes Region, Horn of Africa and Bordering States (RECSA) were engaged in consultative meetings on illicit circulation of small arms and light weapons (SALW) with regard to arms trade treaty and other related regional and transnational security threats. SO3 registered progress in Year Two thereby realising result 3.1: IGAD better equipped to engage in mediation was achieved through organizing different trainings including the training of the IGAD Roster of Technical Experts, and a gender responsive training for mediators and experts from the roster. For SO4, the action is on track to attain result 4.2: IGAD’s position strengthened as regional organization to oversee and coordinate peace and security interventions and programmes in the region with a special attention to women in peace and security. The IGAD Committee of Ambassadors is fully engaged in addressing peace and security issues within the region and IGAD took on a positive role in the restoration of peace in South Sudan and continues to support the implementation of the Revitalized Agreement of Resolution of the Conflict on South Sudan (R-ARCSS), which led to the establishment of the Revitalised Transitional Government of National Unity (R-TGoNU) in South Sudan. The outputs and results recorded are encouraging and somehow show how they contriubte towards the intended objectives.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
